intro: Lepidaploa lehmannii, commonly known as Lehmann's lepidaploa, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in dry, rocky environments and is often found in coastal or mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
